website_summaries.verdict: Pricey yet beautiful. Occasionally, these dimmable lights have some quality issues.
pros: Owners say they have a warm effect similar to that of incandescent light, even when dimmed
cons: Some bulbs burn out faster than expected for LEDs

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not as bright as expected.
customer_reviews.text: They don't quite seem that much brighter in practice as their mCd rating suggests. Definitely brighter, but hard to tell if it scales as one would expect. However, the picture comparing this to the 5000k and stock 40W incandescent bulbs does show a difference: - Top: 5000K 60-Watt Equivalent - Left: 2700K 60-Watt Equivalent - Right: 2700K 40-Watt Incandescent
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Make sure these will fit
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble installing these because the bottom of the bulb above the socket has a ridge that doesn't exist on regular bulbs, and it interfered with my sockets. I was able to make them work by adjusting the center contact in the sockets, but I don't recommend doing that. The warranty for these bulbs is only one year which is the shortest I have seen for an LED bulb. I knocked off a star because of the short warranty and one because of the fit problem. Otherwise, they seem to work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Good LED Bulb
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be good bulbs and I have had them for about a week now on my porch light. So they are working good outside. I am in so cal, so it doesn't get too cold here. One note, I also have some 40w equivalent Phillips bulbs, and these are the same brightness. Either way, these are bright enough for me. In the picture, left is the LOHAS, center is a 60W CFL and right is a 40W Philips Candelabra bulb. It is not that these are dim by any means, it is just that those 40W philips bulbs are super bright.... The light from these is nice and warm in the room. I like these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: jimvia76

customer_reviews.title: these are excellent LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: While pricey, these are excellent LED bulbs. The color temperature is identical to a good quality incandescent. They are brighter than the 60w incandescent too. I've been looking for a quality candelabra bulb for several years and these are the best I have found yet. They feel solid and have some heft to them. I can only assume the heat sink is a decent quality due to the weight. I used them to replace the lights in a chandelier above the dining room table. Dimming feature works very well too. I cannot comment on their longevity as I just installed them.
customer_reviews.author: 68droptop

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Received these to replace existing 60 watt candelabra bulbs in a ceiling fan. My daughter leaves her light on constantly and I couldn't see wasting all that electricity. These LED bulbs came well packaged, individually boxed and well secured by molded plastic wrappers. They arrived in perfect shape and the packaging was very easy to open without scissors or power tools!. The bulbs are as bright as advertised; about the same as the incandescent bulbs they replaced. They are a bit heavier (about twice as heavy), but are still fairly light because of their size. I was interested to see how they dimmed and was pleased to find out they dimmed perfectly. I am totally happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Butchboy

customer_reviews.title: Check Your Socket Before Buying
customer_reviews.text: This item did not work for me. The base is not tapered like a glass bulb is, so it did not fit into my fixture. On the last twist into the socket, the plastic completely broke off of the metal stem and the leads to the LED electronics came disconnected. I had to (carefully) work the broken-off metal base back out of my fixture with a pliers. Before you buy this item, take a close look at the socket it will go into and be sure you have at least a 5/8" gap to accommodate this bulb.
customer_reviews.author: SHANAN D BENTLEY

customer_reviews.title: Great Light and Aesthetics
customer_reviews.text: We have several different brands of LED lights and these are by far the best. They are installed in an open chrome chandelier above the kitchen island and they blend in very well, even when off. Other brands have bulky white bases or diffused plastic tops that turn yellow and distract from the fixture. The light is fantastic and covers the entire room. We rarely use the recessed lights, even when cooking, because these put off bright light to see everything. They are expensive so I only use them in fixtures that expose the bulb. I'll use cheaper (but just as effective) bulbs in fixtures that have shades.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: The torpedo shaped lightbulbs actually quite nice. They are quite bright and has warm color ...
customer_reviews.text: The torpedo shaped lightbulbs actually quite nice. They are quite bright and has warm color almost indistinguishable comparing to my original lightbulbs. If the power consumption rating is accurate, I will be saving a bundle of money over the years. I just hope it will last as claimed. I will be looking for the regular shaped incandescent bulbs replacement for my other lights--obviously LOHAS LED bulbs are preferred; this looking for some good deals.
customer_reviews.author: Bac

customer_reviews.title: I have bought lots of these now
customer_reviews.text: These are great, especially for the price. I been replacing the incandescent bulbs in my outdoor fixtures with these as they burn out and I've been very happy with these. You should know that the light source is higher on these than typical incandescent bulbs, so have a look at how that might affect light in your fixture before ordering. For my outdoor fixtures it doesn't really make a difference other than it's noticeable when you mix these with incandescents, but even then it's not a big deal. I started with one to try it out and I've bought a few 3 packs since then as more old incandescents have failed. I haven't had one of these fail yet.
customer_reviews.author: gadgethog

customer_reviews.title: LED Candelabra Bulbs, LOHAS 6-Watt Dimmable, in Soft White
customer_reviews.text: I purchased six of the LED Candelabra Bulbs, LOHAS 6-Watt Dimmable, in Soft White. I am very pleased with the performance of these LED bulbs. All bulbs worked right out of the box. The bulbs have a brighter appearance than the regular incandescent candelabra bulbs but I see this as a positive feature. The only downside is my chandelier and Lutron CFL dimmer are not totally compatible with the bulbs. To be fair, the chandelier is 14 years old and not designed for LED bulbs. With a five-bulb chandelier, four of the LED bulbs worked perfectly. However, I had to insert one incandescent bulb in order to activate the off switch. Otherwise, the chandelier would not turn off.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: 33% failure rate in less than two hours.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solicited review (two, count them two solicitations). I have had this product for three or four days. When screwed into the socket, they light up. When the switch is pushed, they turn on and off. This is what I paid them for. Part II: After being installed in a ceiling light and after fewer than two hours usage, one of two failed--stopped working completely. That's a thirty-three per cent failure rate for the threesome and 50% for the two installed, almost six dollars down the rat hole. I'll replace the burned out one with the remaining uninstalled light and let you know what happens next.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with LOHAS candelabra LED light bulbs. I replaced old incandecent 40 watt bulbs in a bathroom fixture over the mirror with 60 watt LOHAS LED dimmables. First, I was amazed at how much better the light was overall. I could see myself in the mirror with much less eyestrain and notice those little things that I was missing before. Also, I was impressed at how well the bulbs dimmed. Compared to other LED bulbs I have purchased, these had a much larger range of brightness available and I have not seen a flicker yet. I am very pleased with the purchase and if I needed more candelabra base bulbs I would not hesitate to purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Halle

customer_reviews.title: Was really happy with them until one burned out 10 months later
customer_reviews.text: Bought them in January and installed two in our range hood from ikea. Was really happy with them until one burned out 10 months later. Leds should last for years and years. There's probably a poor design in the power converter. GK Lighting did send me a replacement once I contacted them which I didnt expect them to do. But I do feel like the power supply should be better designed. Ive uploaded the pictures that show signs of burning. The casing did contain it well, but I would probably buy a more expensive brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver McIrwin

customer_reviews.title: Bright. Dims OK. Saves money.
customer_reviews.text: Bright. Used 12 in family room's ridiculous ceiling light and all worked. Nice construction. YES! I will save 400W not to mention the lack of waste heat added to the house that then has to be removed using the inefficient AC. All told I will save 25c or more for every hour it is used. A no brainer: Payback will be in one year as the lights are in a common room. I no longer need to shout at everyone to turn off the light. Dims OK but, like all LEDs, does not get as dim as with incandescent. Small price to pay for an otherwise excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: The Rez

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Delivered August 4th, burned out October 28th. That's a high price to pay for less time than an incandescent would last. Edit: I contacted the seller and they shipped a replacement for the 1 out of 3 that was defective. So I appreciate they honor their warranty. I do like the color and brightness for my bathroom fan fixture. Last edit 12/31: they're all burnt out, including the one replaced by warranty. That's not even 5 months tops. I tried them in multiple fixtures. How do these have good reviews? How does the company stay in business if they have to replace them constantly?
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Works really well in my applications.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bulbs, seem to be appropriate brightness (said to be 60W equivalent, they are a fair bit brighter than the 40W incandescents they replaced), bright white color without being blue-ish. Due to the shape of the base, there is a "cone of darkness" on the socket end of the bulb, but this was not important in my usage (2 of the three ended up upside-down in bell-shaped glass fixtures) since the "dark cone" goes UP! In some usages this may be a bother, though. Also, the light comes on instantly at full blast, unlike some LED bulbs I've met. Very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: K. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my application
customer_reviews.text: I am very advanced in my home automation project, every switch in the house has been changed to a Z-wave smart device linked to a Smartthings hub and Echo Dots scattered throughout the property. I installed a new Hunter fan in the Living Room and therefore needed to update these bulbs to LEDs and chose to purchase this product (all bulbs here are now LED). The Warm White (2700K) is perfect for this application, these bulbs perform flawlessly and I found it to be great value.
customer_reviews.author: Cletus Berkeley

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulb but doesn't last anywhere near what it's rated for.
customer_reviews.text: I like the build and the light. But it does not last even close to 22.8hrs @ 3 hrs per day (25,000 hours) Mine >=4 years old. It is not the primary light in a child's bedroom. And, that child only recently was able to reach the light to turn it on. It would have had to been on a minimum of 17 hours a day!
customer_reviews.author: justin yamada

customer_reviews.title: A bit too long, fine otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: These are a little longer than the candelabra I wanted to replace, so they stick out of my kitchen counter light enclosures. They are also bright, which makes extra length that much noticeable. Just take that into account. They are 6 Watt, 550 Lumen bulbs, nicely packaged. Full length is 102 mm (4.01 inch) The part above the screw area is 83 mm long. The lamps I had were 70 mm long. The light warmth generally matches the incandescent bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Evgenii Puchkaryov

customer_reviews.title: Great Original Bulb Replacement for Ceiling Fans
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased a new ceiling fan in the kitchen/breakfast nook and wanted to convert it to LEDs for the energy savings. Originally tried Daylight 40 Watts but did not like the coloring of the light for the application. Bought these on a whim and they are great. They provide enough light for everyday tasks at the kitchen table and during meals. The shape of the bulb allows the degree of light to be almost equivalent to an original bulb and leave no shadows. I'd highly recommend this product to anyone looking for energy savings.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Great output, great savings.
customer_reviews.text: I installed 6 of these, 3 per fixture, in the carriage style lights on either side of my garage door. I used warm white. They were a bit snug to screw in due to the little flare in the plastic above the screw in part, but they are amazing. When these are on they look identical to the 60W incandescent lights, and the lights being mounted higher inside the body of the bulb casts the light very nicely. These allowed me to reduce the total from 360W for both lights to 36W. Hard to beat that.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Reddish II

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last twelve months for me.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three bulbs lasted less then 10 months in a bedroom lighting fixture that got frequent use. I am giving the benefit of the doubt in two-star rating since perhaps there may have been some electrical issue, unbeknownst to me that contributed. I did not measure the light output before they failed but did seem to be brighter than 60W equivalent incandescent bulb. I have other main-stream brand LED bulbs that are less than the LOHAS wattage equivalency but that have not failed in 12+ months of use.
customer_reviews.author: JFernandez

customer_reviews.title: Lovely light, a little long...
customer_reviews.text: These light bulbs are really terrific. They have a "candelabra-size" base, and they give a gorgeous, bright light. Unfortunately, they are about a half-inch too long for the fixture I bought them for, which is a pendant lamp that uses a candelabra bulb. Hence, they hang out of the glass shade, and cause a bit of a glare. For the record, they are a full four inches from root to tip, so be aware if you're thinking these are the bulbs for you. I give them five stars, even though they're a bit long for me, cuz I do think they're a nice bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C DC

customer_reviews.title: Very good color ( I chose the 2700 which looks just ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good color ( I chose the 2700 which looks just like incandescent light). They are just as bright as the 60watt bulbs they replaced, and they do pretty well. My only negative which is kind of minor, I have them in a candelabra that holds the bulbs upright. Since these bulbs have theri electronics in the base, they do not shine light in a 360 degree pattern. They mostly shine the light from the base out and up. Very slightly downward. Still, they come VERY close to mimicking an incandescent and they save 90% electric. They run a LOT cooler too.
customer_reviews.author: Paulie

customer_reviews.title: I added a pool table and needed better light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Switching out all my house lights for leds to save electricity. While converting my dining room to a game room, I added a pool table and needed better light bulbs. Bought two packs of these as I have two lighting fixtures that use them and I am thrilled with the results. Brighter yet softer light and illuminates the pool table wonderfully! And yes, after replacing more than half my lights with leds-my electric bill has gone down quite a bit! It's pricy up front but well worth it as I haven't had to replace a single led light yet!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lehning

customer_reviews.title: Good Brightness - Reliable at High and Low Room Temperatures
customer_reviews.text: These are slightly brighter than the 60-Watt incandescent equivalent. I had these installed for about a year then I decided that I want more light at this location. I went on a quest to look for higher powered E12 LED bulbs and failed. The other bulbs I've tried with higher wattage (even the Lohas branded 7W) all had at least one failed within 2 months. I ended up going back to these bulbs. I recently bought another set of these to use in our other most-used location, our bathroom. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Manh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Work as advertised. MUCH less expensive than similar bulbs ...
customer_reviews.text: Work as advertised. MUCH less expensive than similar bulbs bought 2 year ago. They dim well, but remember, unlike incandescents, the color temp remains constant while incandescents fade toward the red. So - while you can't tell the difference at full brightness, when dimmed, the LEDs show as a brighter white NOT a fault - - just the physics of the different light sources. I saved a star for the 10 year review and will give it back IF all bulbs are still working Also hoping for a lower price point at that time :-)
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to replace candelabra lights for my dining room and for a few wall sconces. The lights themselves are slightly taller and wider than your normal candelabra lights, but they fit into both fixtures without any issue. The packaging was superb as you can tell they put thought into making sure the lights themselves don't get damaged when shipped. It is a night and day difference in the amount of light these LEDs give off compared to what they replaced. Highly recommend them as candelabra replacements and would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with some E12 Sockets
customer_reviews.text: I tried all three of the bulbs in the package in the three sockets (E12) in one bathroom fixture and none of them worked. They do work in a different fixture, and E12 LED bulbs I bought from a different manufacturer () work fine in that bathroom fixture. I suspect that the relatively wide white portion of these bulbs above the metal base prevents them from screwing far enough into the socket to make contact.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Just what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: I put these in a kitchen ceiling fan to replace the very dim incandescent bulbs it came with and now it actually produces useful light output! The tone of the light may have been a bit too cold but our ceiling fan has an opaque glass shade which dulled/warmed it just enough. I had no problems with the size/shape of the bulb and no weird light patterns were disbursed. If these last for several years they'll deserve that 5th star but they'll have to earn it.
customer_reviews.author: SixtyFourTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Hacked Website
customer_reviews.text: One of the three bulbs was defective. Per the warranty card I have been attempting to contact LOHAS directly to make a partial exchange request. My first attempt was about a week ago. It appeared that the website had been hacked as it said such when I tried to visit the site. A week later nothing shows up when I try to go to the website. I suspect this is a website issue caused by the hack but after a week they have been unable to get the website running again and I have been unable to make a partial return for the defective bulb. The two bulbs that worked look great though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Braden

customer_reviews.title: Great customer satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: The bulb works as advertised but its not very bright and it runs very very HOT. I would be concerned for the circuitry inside lasting long when its running so hot. Heat = bad for electronics. The bright side is the customer service is excellent. Their response is lightening speed. So I believe if any problem arises they will take care of it. They have a huge concern for customer satisfaction which is an important thing to look for when making purchases knowing you will be taken cared of.
customer_reviews.author: Kel-Tec-Innovations

customer_reviews.title: Candelabra LED bulbs work fine!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about LOHAS note saying I might need a new dimmer switch, but my old original house dimmer switch (1974) worked fine with these light bulbs. They give off better light & dim just fine down to about 20% with my old light switch before switching off. The bulbs are a little bit bigger than regular bulbs but fit my light assembly. I will be buying 3 more for my hallway Candelabra. I will put 2 bulbs in each light assembly.
customer_reviews.author: MarineMGySgt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bulbs for living room
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are fantastic. One of the biggest disappointments with our new home purchase has been the builders choice to have all rooms lit using Candelbara based bulbs. These bulbs work perfectly in filling the open floor plan living room and provide excellent ambient light into the kitchen. The color temperature is spot on for a warm feel. I cannot attest to the dimming feature as we do not have a dimmer switch, but I am extremely pleased with my purchase and would be happy to answer any questions I can to a potential buyer.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Very nice light
customer_reviews.text: Finally, an LED light that doesn't put out really nasty light. In fact, these lights are indistinguishable from regular incandescent bulbs -- except for the fact that they draw far less energy and put out far less heat. They're pricey, and it will probably take me decades to recoup my investment in them, but it's nice to know that I'm not drawing huge amounts of energy when my sister leaves the lights on all over the house, which she frequently does. (Her room looks like a lamp store.)
customer_reviews.author: Wordwrkr

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: A Very Pleasing LED My only reason for 4 rather than 5 stars is that the metal body, containing the LED drivers. at max brightness get's hotter than I like, but appears to work very well. The LED chips are well placed and distribute the light over an impressively wide angel. I had considered competitors with aluminum fins that would probably keep them much cooler but considering everything, and price, these LED's are great. Besides, the dimming performance is very good and at slightly reduced brightness that we usually use, the heat is greatly reduced to simply being slightly warm, maybe 100 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for chandelier downlighting
customer_reviews.text: I did not take into consideration that the base of these bulbs would block the light cast downward. These are therefore unsuitable for lighting a table from an overhead chandelier, instead casting a large shadow below the six bulb fixture. Unfortunately, I'll have to reinstall the incandescent bulbs; or turn my chandelier upside down. Color matched nicely the incandescents; brightness perhaps a bit less than the 60 watts. Bulbs came nicely packaged and with prompt delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Will

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these LED lights in an outdoor post light, and so far they seem to be performing well. It was unclear from the Amazon listing whether they are suitable for outdoor use (they are listed as for "general" use) but to date there have been no problems. I'm hoping the LED bulbs will last much longer than the regular bulbs I've used in this post lamp, which have had to be replaced every six months or so.
customer_reviews.author: Lan the Answer Man

customer_reviews.title: Good bright LEDS, Bad Vendor Support
customer_reviews.text: Nice, bright warm white light. Goes well wherever there is a fixture enclosure, like a glass bowl in my case. Convenient candelabra base, as in some ceiling fan lights. And of course, 60 watt equivalent with only 6 watts power. However, after seven months (into a 12 month replacement warranty) one has failed. I sent request with Amazon order number to the seller - and several weeks have passed with nothing. Unreliable vendor, it appears.
customer_reviews.author: Wizard of WID

customer_reviews.title: Failed bulb was replaced quickly, so no complaints
customer_reviews.text: One of the three bulbs failed after a month, but Amazon and vendor replaced it at no charge. The warm white is just a tad more yellow than 'dI like (I have them installed in my home office), but it's a nice pleasing replacement for incandescent, and definitely better than the old greenish CFLs I was using. Lights turn on instantly (no delay as with some LEDs), run relatively cool, and are compact and decent looking, although I would not recommend using them in a bare fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Jim or Julia Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great lights, brighter and cooler than incandescents they replaced.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I replaced 15W incandescents with these for much greater brightness in a fixture installed by a previous resident who apparently preferred dim mood lighting. I noticed that although 4x brighter, these LEDs ran much much cooler to the the touch than the 15W incandescent, they were close to room temperature while the incandescent burned to the touch. These bulbs deliver nice clear light, turn on instantly, and look nice enough to use in an open fixture.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Not really dimmable
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed as these lights are minimally dimmable. They dim about 50% then start to flicker very badly if you try to go any lower and even at 50% they will intermittently start to flicker. The light is also very unidirectional as you can see in the photo due to the opaque silver on the lower half. I bought six and I'm keeping them as most of the fixtures I am using them in are not dimmable anyway. If they were going in a chandelier they would look terrible in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dukes

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a current need for the candalabra base bulbs, but I bought these for the value. My sealing fans use the A19 base and I have LED bulbs throughout my apartment. If I move, I will be ready for the fans that use the candelabra base. I will say that I leave at least two computers, the A/C and four lights running around the clock and my electric bill was $37.50 last month and $38+ the previous month. Obviously the bulbs save money.
customer_reviews.author: WATKINS12

customer_reviews.title: If you want LED that look like the incandescent bulbs that come with it
customer_reviews.text: Needed something that didn't look blue or blue-white for chandler. Ordered 2 other brands and had to return them. After family Christmas no one could tell they weren't the incandescent. If you want LED that look like the incandescent bulbs that come with it, these are it. I don't use a dimmer so can't tell you from that side of it though. I've added 2 compare photos of these and another *brand* stating warm white. LOHAS here are clearly the winners. Hope this saves someone buying 2 other brands and having to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Saylors

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but not as bright as expected
customer_reviews.text: The lamps we purchased came with 60w incandescent candelabra bulbs. I bought these to replace them, using only 10% of the energy. The light emitted is very even, but not as bright as the originals. It seems to me that this has been a common issue with led bulbs, so I guess I need to step up one grade when brightness is an important consideration.
customer_reviews.author: T. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Trips breaker and get dangerously hot!
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't review items but I can't believe these are so highly rated! They are slightly larger than the incandescent bulbs they were replacing, might be an issue for those who don't have much extra room in the fixture. Major problem is they consistently trip my breaker which is a huge pain. I have multiple LEDs around the house along so there is not a problem with the wiring, tried in multiple rooms and these consistently are the issue. They also get dangerously hot after short usage which makes me wonder if they are even saving any energy.
customer_reviews.author: Pritesh

customer_reviews.title: Cautiously optimistic.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving a cautious 5 stars as I have not yet replaced my switch with an LED dimmable switch. These arrived Sunday, it's now Wednesday and they appear to be working as advertised. They are quite expensive so it is difficult at this point to calculate value based on longevity but we're hoping for the best. They replace 5 40 watt traditional bulbs and it does appear to be brighter. They have the extra value of being very attractive in design when lit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gargan

customer_reviews.title: This makes my wife happy, who is extremely particular about colors and always ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd purchase of these lights. They are 'instant-on', no delay, and the light output is the same color as an incandescent. This makes my wife happy, who is extremely particular about colors and always hated the way flourescents and high kelvin led bulbs change the paint colors in the house. Of course, these bulbs last a long time so you will likely never have to replace them and they save a ton of money in electricity. They are well packaged and seem to really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: J Bounds

customer_reviews.title: They don't lat.
customer_reviews.text: Last less than a year on average. I bought 6. All but one have burned out in a year or less running 50% of the time (they are on a daylight sensor). The metal base gets very hot, so I suspect they are using more than a few watts. I do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pick

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I am always a big fan of LED bulbs. I bought quite a few of these bulbs to replace a lot of dim-able sconce lamps and they perform well as well as look great. They seem to emit a little more than 60 watts of light which is quite nice on a dim-able bulb. Out of all the bulbs that I bought, I had no broken bulbs, no loose bases nor any problems of any kind. The bulbs were also very well packed. I will be buying more of these bulbs. I would highly recommend these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck1545

customer_reviews.title: See review
customer_reviews.text: Great full light output, but would only recommend these for that full light output level (when dimmed, they have a very subtle strobe effect). Some of the bulbs we received had a shorter connection tip at the bottom of the bulb, so we had to bend up the metal connection piece/tongue within the socket to make it connect/touch the bulb. If you're handy it's doable (turn off the power). We returned them only because we needed ones that dim without the subtle strobing.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Good quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction. I've had bad luck with some other LED products, so I was skeptical. These are sturdy and fit the normal T12 socket correctly. I have four of these 120V bulbs installed in my RV fixtures. I bought these to reduce the heat and lower my A/C electric consumption. I also found good 12V bulbs by other sellers. My RV is now cooler.
customer_reviews.author: James Mingo

customer_reviews.title: The lights are actually quite nice and I think in some ways they are superior ...
customer_reviews.text: The lights are actually quite nice and I think in some ways they are superior to most LED lights on the market. The reason I am only giving 3 stars is that I had to return them due to the fact that you could see the most of the lower portion of the light when it was put into my chandelier. It gave off plenty of light, but didn't dim to a very low level. I think that used in the proper type of light fixture, these would be great.
customer_reviews.author: trebester

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using 6 of these bulbs in outdoor fixtures for 10 months. I leave them on 24 hours a day. I'm very happy and relieved that none of them have failed, because I tried a couple other LED brands that failed within a couple months. These are bright, and somewhat warm in color. They stay much cooler than incandescent bulbs. Very pleased with them. And I see the price has dropped by $6 since I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dedina

customer_reviews.title: Bright, warm light
customer_reviews.text: I've only had them up for a few days, so I can't speak to their longevity, but they are bright and a soft warm light, not the cool blue light of some LEDs. They do seem slightly less bright than the 60 watt bulbs they replaced, but not by much. They were also packaged very carefully and arrived on time. They are incredibly expensive, however. I will add the 5th star once I see that they've lasted significantly longer than regular bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Madhuri

customer_reviews.title: Great Vendor, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Items were well-packed ensuring safe delivery. Package arrived earlier than expected. Product is exactly what I needed, to fit a ceiling fan light fixture that uses candelabra bulbs. It was difficult to find LED bulbs with the highest lumens, and LOHAS came through with these 60-watt equivalent (550 lumens) bulbs. The fact that they are also dimmable is a major plus. I'm very satisfied with LOHAS and will purchase from them again!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Truly a 60 watt replacement
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I thought would be needed, but a good solid heat sink should help with a long life. Placed them in a ceiling fan where they replaced 3 GE 60 watt bulbs. They are equal brightness to the GE's maybe a tad brighter. The color seams a bit higher than the 2700* listed, but is the perfect temp for a large living room. They are a little larger than the GE's but fit under the globe without hitting.
customer_reviews.author: mjljr

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: First off let me start that we have been purchasing high efficiency bulbs for years and we love them. These would be great if two out of the three that came with the pack didn't break off of the bulb housing. I was extremely gentle and one wire snapped off of the housing. I let my wife try the other, after she stated that I was too rough. The same thing happened to her. If you are looking for quality control, these are not the bulbs you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Faulty?
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three bulbs have burnt out. With minimal use. One the day after it was installed, so we figured it was bad luck. The second burnt out yesterday. We've had these for two months.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon O.

customer_reviews.title: Great for ceiling fans!
customer_reviews.text: The light output of these things is fantastic. The wide angle distribution of the light works well in ceiling fans. Its the first bulb I have found that bounces enough light off of the ceiling. I suspect the the light is slightly bluer than the stated 2700 kelvin rating, maybe 3500? but I don't have a meter here. Update:This was a 5 star review. They have started failing. I think incandescents were lasting longer.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great! I use a lot of LED's and these ...
customer_reviews.text: Great! I use a lot of LED's and these fix the problem of the light only coming out of the top half quite well by putting them in a circle around the side. they are nice and bright, and have a good color light too. I put them up in a fixture next to some incandescent and the light color/temperature was so similar you couldn't really notice. I've been using them about a month now and I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lainers

customer_reviews.title: Brighter than the original bulbs, as well as more energy efficient.
customer_reviews.text: We have a dimmable lamp,, so when one of the 5 bulbs on it died we decided to try these LED bulbs. They are noticeable brighter than the original bulbs, which is a good thing. We have three of these lamps, so as the original bulbs die out we intend on replacing them with these LED bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my bathroom candelabras
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my bathroom candelabras. I am switching to all LEDs and these are a perfect fit. The color and brightness is perfect. I will update about the reliability as the only thing that concerns me is the 1 year warranty. As others have stated, a lot of the other brands offer up to 3 years for their warranties. Won't be an issue if they last 22 years ;)
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good color temp and dimmability as a replacement for incandescents.
customer_reviews.text: These 2700k dimmable candelabra bulbs are used over our kitchen sink and work great for that application. We have been replacing multiple incandescents with LEDs around the house and these are some of the best we have used. They do a great job at dimming (with an older dimmer not rated as CFL LED compatible), the color temperature is very close to the yellow-ish light of the incandescents, and they do not buzz. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Denogginizer

customer_reviews.title: Real warm white
customer_reviews.text: A room in my house has 3 fixtures, each with 5, 60 watt candelabra bulbs. 900 watts total for the room. I was afraid to replace the incandescents because IMO nothing else gives of a true warm white color. After installing these LED bulbs I couldn't tell the difference in the color of the light and as a bonus, they are a little brighter too. I ordered 15 bulbs and they all lit up and are still lit. Looking forward to the energy savings.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Great bulbs. I replaced the three 40W E12 bulbs in a bedroom ceiling fan with these. The 6W LEDs use 85% less power and produce brighter light. I was amazed to see how much more light we had in the room after the upgrade. Best of all they are dimmable and do so smoothly and evenly. At the dimmest setting they are brighter than the incandescent bulbs they replaced but its not a big problem. Overall I am very happy with these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Parabellum

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great bulb and value! My cathedral ceiling lights are hard to replace, as it means getting out a 16' ladder. The previous bulbs were burning out every year, so this year I replaced all of them with these LED bulbs. They are brighter, and also dimmable as promised. My experience with these lights is they last much longer so I look forward to not being on the ladder every single year.
customer_reviews.author: EveS

customer_reviews.title: Work Well, But Not Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: None of these bulbs worked in the kitchen fixture I had planned on using them in. Incandescent and CFLs work fine in that fixture. Mysterious. They did, however, work very well in my daughter's ceiling fan/light unit. They are plenty bright, and I like the warm color temperature in the room. I also like them being at full brightness immediately, as opposed to CFLs which seem to take a little while to warm up.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color, bright natural light
customer_reviews.text: Perfect color, bright natural light. I bought a ceiling fan and didn't realize it required candelabra bulbs. Didn't want the incandescent bulbs it came with as they use so much energy. I initially bought 5,000k bulbs and the light in the room was too bright and blue. These are perfect... warm yet still bright. Fast shipping, great seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dimmable LED bulb for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with these bulbs thus far. The bulbs came well packaged and their price is competitive compared to more expensive LED bulbs. I installed these in a Hunter ceiling fan on a dimmer switch. These are dimmable and don't flicker or buzz like cheaper bulbs do. I didn't have any issues with installation - I expect to get good life from them and save some money on my energy bill. Only time will tell how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs were packaged well so they wouldn't be damaged in shipping. They appear to be well made and produced an immediate pleasant-colored light as soon as they were turned on. This is better than compact fluorescent lights that take awhile to reach full brightness. I was also pleased with the brightness because the 6 watt bulbs truly had the brightness of traditional 60 watt bulbs. I would definitely buy LOHAS LEDs again.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Brannam

customer_reviews.title: Lighting is very good, does not have the appeal of a full glass bulb.
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy these again, I did not think about it when I bought them, but I do not like that half of the bulb is aluminum. I have these bulbs for looks and when you cannot see the light from below, it does not have the appeal of the incandescent bulbs. The lighting is very good, I am just disappointed with its looks.
customer_reviews.author: UNK

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for standard incandescent bulbs. All of my ceiling fans are on a dimmer control so I needed a led that could be dimmed, these work great. Have purchased others that were no as reliable. Light output is fantastic, much better than the incandescents they replaced. First set has been in for over 6 months in our living room and still going strong. On almost all day.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Rath

customer_reviews.title: Half the bulb is "base" rather than filament.  Newer designs exist that are better.
customer_reviews.text: Note that half the body is "base" and not filament. These are an older design. You can find newer designs where the whole thing is filament. It makes a difference in a chandelier. They have at least been reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Loyd

customer_reviews.title: Good price for Led Candelabra bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I am changing all my light bulbs to LED to save on electricity and I like the brightness. The candelabra bulbs are hard to find in a 60 watt without paying an arm and leg for them especially when you need more than one at these are exactly what I wanted and they were great they come on immediately whenever I turn on my lights to my ceiling fan
customer_reviews.author: Flsunshine

customer_reviews.title: I liked them so much
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a ceiling fan. They are small, lower power, and very bright. I liked them so much, my dad tried them out - we ended up buying 15 and placing them in all fans in their house. Then my aunt wanted some for hers. These are the best candelabra bulbs I've seen, and 60W equivalents are hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: J. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs... Until the all burned out
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs worked extremely well and were perfectly bright, until the started burning out one by one after about 5 or 6 months. Overall, definitely not worth purchasing these again. I purchased 4 total bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bloodgood

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb for ceiling fan lights
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace old school bulbs that came with two new ceiling fans. These bulbs are great so far. They are exactly what i expected. They are same color as old bulbs (2700k) and just as bright in terms of lumens. I currently do not have a dimmer switch, but plan to install soon. Based on the experience so far, i would buy these again and plan to try other bulb types from Luhas.
customer_reviews.author: JasonK712

customer_reviews.title: Great, and they last
customer_reviews.text: I have about 15 of these working in various rooms and fixtures, been about 2 years hand have not had to replace even one of them, nice and bright too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend them and I've actually given an extra bulb that ...
customer_reviews.text: We installed this in a new lighting fixture in our entryway and I have to say I am incredibly impressed. Not only are they very bright and don't get hot but they actually have almost a vintage look with the way the LEDs are arranged. I highly recommend them and I've actually given an extra bulb that we had to my mother-in-law because she loved it as much as much as we did.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: You don't even get the loud "Pop" when they fail, like the old bulbs did... :)
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 3-packs in October 2015. Fitted 3 bulbs in a hallway electrolier. Light was good and they worked well with the dimmer switch, but one bulb failed after only 3 weeks and another one only lasted until May 2015; The lifespan is not even as good as the old incandescent bulbs. You get what you pay for, and I shall be buying a more reliable, albeit more expensive brand in future. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs for the price
customer_reviews.text: Really good light bulbs for the price.Too me they are slightly brighter than a traditional 60W built but I'm not complaining. I have purchased two sets of these already and been very happy with them. The dim feature works great as well and with instant on, there is no warm up needed.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Campos

customer_reviews.title: Twice the light
customer_reviews.text: Ok, maybe technically not twice the lumens , but the builder installed bulbs were 40 watt 120v lifeless bulbs. We thought we would have to change the fan light out and install a new, BUT the 7 watt LED bulb was the solution . You can now turn on the overhead fan light and see what's in the room. Bulbs a just a little fatter around but fit with out a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dj21

customer_reviews.title: One of these burnt out in 8 months, barely ...
customer_reviews.text: One of these burnt out in 8 months, barely used. Clearly defective. LOHAS doesn't answer their phone or respond to emails about their defective products. Traditional tungsten lights last that long and cost a fraction of the price. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel A. Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement bulbs for the newer wattage-limited ceiling fan light kits!
customer_reviews.text: We have a relatively new house in which all the ceiling fans have limited wattage light kits for energy efficiency (not to exceed 40W each). Until we found these LED candelabra bulbs, the fan lights were virtually useless. After installation, we were very surprised at the amount of light - what a difference. I will be buying 3 more sets to upgrade all of the low-wattage fan kits in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: It seems like they are constantly burning out
customer_reviews.text: What a relief to find these!!! I go through regular lightbulbs almost every couple months in our ceiling fan. It seems like they are constantly burning out. I was so happy to find these. I love the low-wattage, but high output lighting, and only $0.75 per year. It says it should last 10+ years or so. I'll update as we go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a 60 watt eqivalent candelbra
customer_reviews.text: I have an inverted Quoizel tiffany lamp with 6 candelebra sockets. I must use the 60 watters to properly light the lamp. The extreme heat burns up sockets and I am on my 4th set of sockets in 17 years. At last I found an LED candelbra as bright as the incandescents and they run as cool as cucumbers. Now, if they will just last as LEDs usually do, I will be thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclops50

customer_reviews.title: Best I have found.
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest LED candelabra bulbs I have found. They actually tend toward warm color as advertised - unlike others I have purchased. I liked them enough to buy another set. Perfect for our ceiling fans. Only con is the lack of light dispersion toward the base. Choose wisely for the type of fixture you will use them in. In most cases this will not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoPope

customer_reviews.title: Good bright bulb with significant energy savings
customer_reviews.text: Good bright bulb with significant energy savings. Looks a lot like the cadelabra I was trying to replace. Also had the right dimensions to fit in the ceiling fan. Most others either wouldn't fit the length and/or didn't like to be horizontal rather than vertical. The 60W replacement variety was harder to find than the 40W. One bulb in the three pack didn't last long , but customer service was great and they sent a replacement right away. I plan to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great light output, color and size.
customer_reviews.text: Great light output, perfect color and the size was just right for my ceiling fan. Update 9-19-16 These lights really brighten up the room much better than the old CFL's. I don't have a problem with the one year warranty time as they should out live that easily. I will update the review as time passes. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: SPG900T

customer_reviews.title: Really brightens a room efficiently
customer_reviews.text: While I don't like candelabra bulbs on principle that is what our house had over the dining room table. These bulbs work great, brightens the room efficiently and dim to allow you to adjust the lighting to your mood or style. I was very pleased with how well they worked. After 500 hours, no issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: scopes

customer_reviews.title: Replacement bulbs on their way
customer_reviews.text: Dec 2016: two of three bulbs have failed within 6-7 months. one in enclosed exterior fixture and the other interior candelabra. pretty disappointing to have incandescent outlast LED <2 Stars> ***UPDATED (Jan 2017): Seller is replacing both of the failed bulbs. Once received, will perform another long term test and then post an update. Very pleased by the Seller's prompt response. <3 Stars>
customer_reviews.author: Archer07

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the money
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of a nice quality. Packaged well. Used in a three light ceiling fan. Bulbs are instant on and a nice tungsten/incandescent color temp. I read some complaints about brightness...They are not dim by any means. Probably 50 watt equivalents. A longer warranty would be nice but we will see what time hands me with these. So far very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs! Perfect replacements for incandescents
customer_reviews.text: Great bulbs! Perfect replacements for incandescents. Nice warm yellow glow instead of harsh white/blue. And great, all-around coverage which is especially important as the chandelier is hanging 3 ft above a table (other LED's didn't shine down enough). As long as they last as long as they're supposed to, I'll be very happy. I bought 13 for two different chandeliers.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Natishan

customer_reviews.title: I have this product for over 5 months now, ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this product for over 5 months now, all seem to be holding up and have had no issue thus far. We bought these along with a few doze other LED bulbs for every socket in the house. Unfortunately, we didn't have regular bulbs for a few months to see what the cost savings has been on the electricity bill, but I do know our neighbor seems to pay about $50 a month or so than us for theirs. So consider it an upfront investment...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Rare Performance !!
customer_reviews.text: I used these bulbs in a lamp that was very restrictive--both in the size and shape of what it allowed to be installed, as well as the amount of current drawn without shutting off. After many hours of searching over several months, these were the only bulbs of five types tried that allowed full illumination in my lamp.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Great to go green but to much packaging
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 4 1/2 if only for the fact that as both a bonus and negative with how much packaging is used just seems a little excessive sense I got LED to be more green. Otherwise it is as listed perfect LED's that are pretty feel hefty and solid major bonus for the whole feeling of it. Looks nice and works well I will update when I have been using them for more than a year see how things go.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great substitution for regular bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Installed them on a ceiling fan in lieu of the incandescent bulbs that came with it. Despite being only 6 watts, the light provided is much stronger than the original bulbs, and more uniform. We love that they produce no heat, so that the area can be accessed at any moment, even if the light has been on for a while. All in all, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Two of the three failed within two months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 3-pack. Installed two in a fixture and one of them failed after six weeks. Installed the third as a replacement and it only lasted two weeks. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: davensara

customer_reviews.title: Bright bulbs. Reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, especially comparatively. Dimming works well. There is a slight flicker on the low dimmer settings, but nothing major. There is no visible flicker at the brighter settings. The color is a little whiter than the other 2700K bulbs we use, but it's not terrible. It's definitely more of a white light.
customer_reviews.author: Scott & Ellie

product_meta.title: L LOHAS LED Candelabra Bulb, Dimmable 60-Watt Light Bulbs Equivalent, LED 6-Watt Warm White 2700K Chandelier Bulbs, Decorative Candle Light Bulb E12 Candelabra Base, 120V, 550 Lm, Torpedo Shape(3 Pack)
product_meta.description:
How to use the smart bulb?
There are 3 steps to start your smart life. 
1.Scan the QR code to download the APP
2.Install the LED smart bulb
3.Use the APP to control the Wi-Fi bulb

How does LOHAS smart WiFi bulb work?
This smart bulb works with Wi-Fi or mobile network, controlled by APP on smart phone. The APP can be download by scanning the QR code on the package, or searching in app store.

Feature:

Support Voice Control 
This smart LED bulb Compatible with Alexa and Google Assistant. You can turn on/off the Wi-Fi light, adjust the color temperature or brightness via your voice. 

Support Group Control 
You can create groups on the app to manage two or more smart light bulbs. Synchronous control will be realized through smart lamp group.

Support Remote Control
Control this 5 watt (40w equivalent) bulb no matter where you are. Turn it on/off without leaving your bed or before going back home.

Safe and Reliable
No lead or mercury. No UV or IR. CE, RoHS, FCC compliant, created a healthy home space for your family. Perfect for indoor lighting, museum, restaurants, bar, cafe, living room, bedroom, holiday birthday party, etc. One year warranty.

Specifications:
Package: 2 pieces (5W WIFI Smart LED Bulb) 
CRI: >80Ra (vivid and natural light) 
Color: Multicolored + Daylight White (6000K) 
Luminous Intensity: 450LM 
Aluminum & Material: PC (good heat dissipation) 
IP: IP20 (Indoor use only) 
LED Working Temperature: -25 degree - +45 degree 
Life Span: 30,000 hours

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars995 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
